Package controllerGui

Class HostClientController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controllerGui.HostClientController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IScreen
    public class HostClientController
extends java.lang.Object
implements IScreen
    Host Client GUI controller, implements Screen interface Handler for first screen of client-server connection
    Author:
    Lidor

    • Method Detail

      • SendPort

        private void SendPort​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Handles the action of sending the entered host and port to the server in order to establish a connection. Validates that the input is not empty and that the port is an integer. Navigates to the login screen if the connection is successful, otherwise displays an error message.
        Parameters:
        event - the event that triggered this method

      • start

        public void start​(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
           throws java.lang.Exception
        The start method is responsible for setting the current screen in the Navigation Store to HostClient and checking if a machine id has been provided. If no machine id has been provided, a warning message is displayed to the user.
        Parameters:
        primaryStage - The primary stage of the application.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface IScreen
